channel.title: Which of these?
channel.description: http://www.overclockers.co.uk/search_results.php?sortby=&groupid=701&search=1.5tb i was thinking the seagate as i already have a seagate that runs very well, my second choice would be the F2, but i thought i'd ask for opinions before i bought it so gogogo

item.title: Which of these?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

eczema3:

As far as I am aware, larger hard-drives (usually 1TB+) have reliability issues, it’s better to go for 2 (or 3) 500gb or so drives.

I have a cheap hitachi 2TB drive, no problems so far.

Read full topic

item.title: Which of these?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Whoops didn’t specify which one I was talking about: Western Digital RE4 1.5TB SATA-II 64MB Cache - OEM (WD1503FYYS)

Besides the fact that I use one of these on my home media server, it also is the best out of all, just read the specs.

7,200 RPM spin speed vs 5,200
64MB Cache vs 32MB Cache
5 Year Warranty vs 3 Year Warranty

You can tell alot about the quality of a product just by how long the manufacture sets the warranty for. It may as well be this product is good for x or more years. For Western Digital it is this product is good forever.

Read full topic
